snippet: Characterized as a gesture of good will, the donation was aimed at fostering development in Srebrenica, where 8,000 Muslims were massacred by Bosnian Serb forces.
abstract: Serbia will donate roughly $5.4 million to develop economy in Bosnian town of Srebrenica, site of 1995 massacre that claimed lives of some 8,000 Muslim men and boys at Bosnian hands; gesture is meant to strike tone of reconciliation, though many Bosnians express skepticism.
lead_paragraph: Characterized as a gesture of good will, the donation was aimed at fostering development in Srebrenica, where 8,000 Muslims were massacred by Bosnian Serb forces.

headline.main: Serbia to Give $5.4 Million to Bosnian Town, Site of 1995 Massacre
headline.print_headline: Serbia Gives Bosnia Town $5.4 Million in Good Will

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
